Through ‚ÄúBuild America, Buy America,‚Äù Biden-Harris Administration is investing in American workers, creating good-paying, union jobs¬†

Click here to view the third installment of the Investing in America short-form video series¬†
WASHINGTON ‚Äì Today, the U.S. Department of Transportation released the third installment of its ‚ÄúInvesting in America‚Äù video series focused on the men and women producing American-made steel out of Coatesville, Pennsylvania, and the ‚ÄúBuild America, Buy America‚Äù provisions of President Biden‚Äôs Infrastructure Law. ¬†
The ‚ÄúBuild America, Buy America‚Äù Act, enacted as part of the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, broadly requires all federally funded infrastructure projects be built with American-made iron, steel, manufactured products, and construction materials. With more than 50,000 projects underway that are funded by the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, American workers in towns across the country are rebuilding and improving the infrastructure we count on ‚Äì roads, bridges, airports, railways, and transit systems ‚Äì with materials made right here in America.¬†
The video features members of United Steel Workers (USW) Local 1165 in Coatesville, Pennsylvania, including Brandon, a third-generation Coatesville resident, and Stacey, a USW member for more than 35 years. Steel produced at the Coatesville mill is being used in infrastructure...[Content truncated]

QA.Question: Did President Biden actually wear a hard hat backwards during the photo op in Wisconsin?
QA.Answer: Based on the evidence retrieved, it is confirmed that President Joe Biden was photographed wearing a hard hat backwards during a photo opportunity with union construction workers in Superior, Wisconsin. Reports indicate that there were several discussions and observations raised regarding this incident, leading Snopes to initially fact-check the image. Eventually, Snopes was compelled to reverse their initial assessment to confirm that Biden indeed wore the hard hat backwards, acknowledging the flood of comments and scrutiny they received online about the photograph. This conclusion is supported by various sources that pointed out the specifics of the incident, confirming that the photograph taken during the event shows Biden with the hard hat in the incorrect orientation.
